getY().Description: Return the value of the Y dimension or 0 for a 1D allocation.

getElement().Description: Return the element associated with this Type.

Parameters: Element: The Element for the Type
int: The X dimension, must be > 0
createX(android.renderscript.RenderScrip.Description: Utility function for creating basic 1D types. The type is created without mipmaps enabled.
createX(android.renderscript.RenderScrip.FullName: public static Type createX (RenderScript rs, Element e, int dimX)

getX().Description: Return the value of the X dimension.

Parameters: Element: The Element for the Type
int: The X dimension, must be > 0
int: The Y dimension, must be > 0
int: The Z dimension, must be > 0
createXYZ(android.renderscript.RenderScr.Description: Utility function for creating basic 3D types. The type is created without mipmaps.

Parameters: Element: The Element for the Type
int: The X dimension, must be > 0
int: The Y dimension, must be > 0
createXY(android.renderscript.RenderScri.Description: Utility function for creating basic 2D types. The type is created without mipmaps or cubemaps.

hasFaces().Description: Return if the Type is a cube map.

getZ().Description: Return the value of the Z dimension or 0 for a 1D or 2D allocation.

hasMipmaps().Description: Return if the Type has a mipmap chain.

getCount().Description: Return the total number of accessable cells in the Type.

ClassDesc: A Type describes the @B_android#renderscript#Element_E@ and dimensions used for an @B_android#renderscript#Allocation_E@ or a parallel operation. Types are created through @B_android#renderscript#Type#Builder_E@. A Type always includes an @B_android#renderscript#Element_E@ and an X dimension. A Type may be multidimensional, up to three dimensions. A nonzero value in the Y or Z dimensions indicates that the dimension is present. Note that a Type with only a given X dimension and a Type with the same X dimension but Y = 1 are not equivalent. A Type also supports inclusion of level of detail (LOD) or cube map faces. LOD and cube map faces are booleans to indicate present or not present. A Type also supports YUV format information to support an @B_android#renderscript#Allocation_E@ in a YUV format. The YUV formats supported are @B_android#graphics#ImageFormat#YV12_E@, @B_android#graphics#ImageFormat#NV21_E@, and @B_android#graphics#ImageFormat#YUV_420_888_E@
